intro: Aphanamixis wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in temperate and alpine regions, often growing at high altitudes. Aphanamixis wallichii is also known for its toxic sap, which contains cardiac glycosides.
